title: 【やさしい日本語】ウクライナの 女性(じょせい)が、核兵器(かくへいき)の 怖(こわ)さを 紹介(しょうかい)する 動画(どうが)を つくった
cleaned_sentences: [Easy Japanese] A Ukrainian woman has created a video introducing the scary nature of nuclear weapons.
Ekaterina Since February last year, Russia has been attacking Ukraine.
Ekaterina Chaprinsika fled from Ukraine to Japan and lives in Tagawa City, Fukuoka Prefecture with her 3-year-old daughter.
Ekaterina is worried that the Russian president might use nuclear weapons.
Last October, Ekaterina went to Hiroshima City.
Hiroshima City is a city where nuclear weapons were used in 1945.
Ekaterina went to the atomic bomb facility and learned about the scary nature of nuclear weapons.
We then created a video introducing the facilities.
When I put it on YouTube and Facebook, people in Russia started watching.
"I think the people in Russia want peace," said Ekaterina.
I hope that the Russians who watched the video will stop the president.
